intro: Mapouria alba, commonly known as the white mapouria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially grown.
